songApp

Class Song

  • java.lang.Object
    • songApp.Song

  • public class Song
extends java.lang.Object
    Song Class: Will read through a text file, and create a new list of notes for the piano to play. Used to determine where there is a rest, where there is a note and how long the duration of the note is.
    Author:
    672749

    • Constructor Detail

      • Song

        public Song()

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                      InvalidNoteException
        readFile method: used to go through the file and append it to an arraylist. Checks for a rest or a note. If it is a rest, sleep for 200 milliseconds. If there is a note, check for each case of note constructors to determine what type of note it is. increased durations for notes are indicated by the "-" sign. If the note cannot be interpreted then it is discarded.
        Parameters:
        filename - - the file to read the notes from
        Returns:
        - ArrayList of strings representing the notes in the song.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - The file cannot be read
        InvalidNoteException - - The note cannot be parsed

      • playSong

        public void playSong(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> notes)
              throws InvalidNoteException
        playSong method: creates a new piano to play the song and goes through the arraylist created from the readFile method and plays each note. The default duration is 200 milliseconds, unless specified by a -, therefore the duration is 400 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        notes - - the arraylist of notes to be played by the piano
        Throws:
        InvalidNoteException - - if a note cannot be interpreted properly.
